H0.text: Oil and coal are the two energy resources that present the most dangerous risks and consequences for the environment during their acquisition, among all energy resources that have benefits, risks, and drawbacks.

H1.text: Coal and solar energy present the most dangerous risks and consequences for the environment during their acquisition, according to the question that all energy resources have benefits, risks, and drawbacks.

H2.text: Geothermal energy and oil present the most dangerous risks and consequences for the environment during their acquisition.

H3.text: Solar energy and geothermal energy are the two resources that present the most dangerous risks and consequences for the environment during their acquisition, among all energy resources that have benefits, risks, and drawbacks.

A4.text: When oil and gas are burned they release carbon dioxide into the air.

A5.text: Oil can also cause oil spills, which pollutes the ocean.
